page.title: 19PAYROLL ROBBERY AND MURDER
page.content: On Thursday 17th January 1985 just after 9 a.m. an army landrover left Glencorse Barracks with three army personnel on board, a driver and two others . They were Major David Cunningham (retired), staff sergeant Terrance Hosker and Private John Thomson (driver). They went to the Royal Bank of Scotland at 42 John Street, Penicuik. They collected the money from the bank by using the rear entrance which opened onto the car park in Jackson Street. Shortly after this the Police Station at Penicuik were informed that the Land Rover had failed to return to the barracks with the money. A search of Penicuik and the surrounding area was started. At about 11 a.m. the empty Land Rover was found lying in a ditch approximately half a mile from the Flotterstone Inn
